utils

Class SceneUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.SceneUtility

  • public class SceneUtility
extends Object
    Utility class to perform operations needed in scenes (i.e., changing scenes, formatting data, showing dialogs)
    Author:
    Rachel Orrell

      • setRootPath

        public static void setRootPath(String path)
        Set root path for fxml files

      • changeScene

        public void changeScene(ActionEvent ae,
                        String currentFxml,
                        String targetFxml,
                        SceneChanger changer)
        Loads a new scene in the current stage with both a primary and secondary id
        Parameters:
        ae - ActionEvent from button calling this method
        currentFxml - filename of current scene
        targetFxml - filename of desired scene
        changer - the SceneChanger object defining parameters
        See Also:
        SceneChanger

      • formatAsDate

        public static String formatAsDate(String text)
                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Format String as date xx/xx/xxxx, allowing shorthand (i.e., 1/1 or 1/1/14)
        Parameters:
        text - the String to format
        Returns:
        String
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if not valid date or valid date shorthand

      • parseDateForDB

        public static Date parseDateForDB(String text)
        Parse date String into format for a Date field in a derby database; invalid input will result in a null return value
        Parameters:
        text - the date String to parse
        Returns:
        Date object

      • showConfirmationDialog

        public static boolean showConfirmationDialog(String text)
        Show a confirmation dialog to the user
        Parameters:
        text - dialog content text will be "Are you sure you want to " + text + "?"
        Returns:
        boolean indicating whether the user clicked OK

      • showError

        public static void showError(String text)
        Show a custom error dialog to the user
        Parameters:
        text - the content text to show the user

      • showActionError

        public static void showActionError(String text)
        Show an error dialog associated with a specific action to the user; intended to promote uniformity of error dialog message syntax
        Parameters:
        text - a phrase beginning with a gerund; the content text will be "There was an error " + text + "."

      • showDecimalPrecisionError

        public static void showDecimalPrecisionError(String fieldName,
                                             int precision)
        Show an error dialog associated with putting too large a decimal number in a text field (assumes a number formatted to 2 decimal places)
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the text of the label associated with the textfield
        precision - the allowed precision of the field (total number of digits allowed to the left and right of the decimal)

      • showMissingFieldError

        public static void showMissingFieldError()
        Show an error stating "Please fill in all required fields (indicated with bold red font)."

      • requiredFieldsCompleted

        public static boolean requiredFieldsCompleted(Collection<TextField> fields)
        Checks whether all the given TextFields have been filled out
        Parameters:
        fields - a collection of TextFields
        Returns:
        true if all fields completed; false otherwise
